name: df-totbnd
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(ctotbnd, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cfv(cmet, cv(s0)), wral(s2, crp, wrex(s3, cfn, wa(wceq(cuni(cv(s3)), cv(s0)), wral(s4, cv(s3), wrex(s5, cv(s0), wceq(cv(s4), co(cv(s5), cfv(cbl, cv(s1)), cv(s2)))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ TotBnd =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà(Met ` s0)| ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà ‚Ñù+, ‚àÉ(s3 ‚àà Fin,(‚ãÉ s3 = s0 ‚àß ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s3, ‚àÉ(s5 ‚àà s0, s4 =(s5[(ball ` s1)]s2))))))})
comment: Define the class of totally bounded metrics. A metric space is totally bounded iff it can be covered by a finite number of balls of any given radius. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)
